instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message:
Hello, 
I have a board 820-2939 not turning on, green light, no fan spin

PPBUS_G3H 12.4v
SMC_RESET_L 3.3v

PP5V_SUS 0v

????PM_SUS_EN 0V
PM_SLP_SUS_L 3.3V
PP3V3_S5 3.3V


Already replaced U7940 and Q7820
Always PM_SUS_EN

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message: PPBUS is 12.4? That is too low possibly crap under the SMC. Double check that measurement.

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message:
Missing SMC_BATLOW_L?
Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 1 charger.

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message:
SMC_BATLOW_L 0v is missing ( when I have to get this signal ?)
PPBUS_G3H is 12.22v

I don't have the original Cable but I have a 85w cable with the power supply, this one that i use for repair.

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message: 12.22 is too low. Start by reflowing the SMC. If it doesn?t go to 12.6, then either bad ISL or bad SMC

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message: Replaced ISL and reballed SMC, same problem

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message:
Probably need to change SMC.
Check first diode mode and voltage on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message: SCL/SDA 3.4v, diode mode was 0.23 on both line, I replaced the ISL now it is 0.512

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS now? If still 12.2, replace SMC MUST come from 820-2936 donor board

threads.title: 820-2936-b no pp5v_sus
threads.message: Yes still 12.22v, okay I will buy a donor board
